channel.title: admin on Global freshwater biodiversity research
channel.description: Recent content in admin on Global freshwater biodiversity research

item.description: Sami Domisch is a Leibniz Junior Research Group Leader at the Leibniz-Institute of Freshwater Ecology and Inland Fisheries. Sami is interested in freshwater biodiversity with an emphasis on spatial biodiversity patterns, macroecology, and developing tools to assess freshwater biodiversity across large spatial scales. The group uses a wide array of open-source for spatial biodiversity informatics such as R, GRASS, GDAK/OGR, pktools, OpenForis within the Linux environment.
